plants.name: Mango
plants.description: Mango is a tropical fruit known for its sweet and juicy flavor.
plantingTips: Plant mango seeds in a sunny location.
Water regularly, especially during the flowering and fruiting stages.
Prune trees to maintain shape and improve air circulation.

plants.name: Tomato
plants.description: Tomato is a versatile fruit commonly used in various culinary dishes.
plantingTips: Start tomato seeds indoors before the last frost date.
Transplant seedlings into the garden after the soil has warmed.
Provide support for tomato plants to prevent them from sprawling.

plants.name: Ginger
plants.description: Ginger is a flavorful and aromatic spice with medicinal properties.
plantingTips: Plant ginger rhizomes in a shallow trench with the buds facing upward.
Keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
Harvest ginger roots when the leaves turn yellow and begin to die back.

plants.name: Pepper
plants.description: Pepper, also known as bell pepper or capsicum, is a popular vegetable used in cooking.
plantingTips: Start pepper seeds indoors 8-10 weeks before the last frost date.
Transplant seedlings into the garden after the soil has warmed.
Provide consistent moisture and support for pepper plants as they grow.

plants.name: Potato
plants.description: Potato is a starchy tuberous crop widely consumed around the world.
plantingTips: Plant potato seed pieces in trenches or mounds spaced 12-15 inches apart.
Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
Hill soil around potato plants to prevent tubers from being exposed to sunlight.

plants.name: Rice
plants.description: Rice is a staple food crop grown in flooded fields called paddies.
plantingTips: Prepare flooded fields for rice cultivation, ensuring uniform water depth.
Sow rice seeds directly into the flooded fields or transplant seedlings.
Manage water levels carefully throughout the growing season.

plants.name: Wheat
plants.description: Wheat is a cereal grain widely cultivated for its nutritious seeds.
plantingTips: Sow wheat seeds directly into prepared soil in the fall for winter wheat or in the spring for spring wheat.
Keep soil evenly moist but not waterlogged.
Harvest wheat when the grains are fully mature and dry.

plants.name: Litchi
plants.description: Litchi is a tropical fruit known for its sweet and fragrant taste.
plantingTips: Plant litchi trees in a sunny location protected from strong winds.
Provide regular irrigation during the dry season.
Prune litchi trees to maintain shape and promote fruiting.

plants.name: Strawberry
plants.description: Strawberry is a delicious and nutritious fruit grown in temperate regions.
plantingTips: Plant strawberry runners or bare-root crowns in well-prepared soil.
Ensure good air circulation and soil drainage to prevent diseases.
Mulch around strawberry plants to suppress weeds and retain moisture.

plants.name: Lettuce
plants.description: Lettuce is a leafy vegetable commonly used in salads and sandwiches.
plantingTips: Sow lettuce seeds directly into the garden or start seedlings indoors.
Keep soil consistently moist and provide shade in hot weather.
Harvest lettuce leaves when they reach the desired size.

plants.name: Carrot
plants.description: Carrot is a root vegetable prized for its sweet and crunchy texture.
plantingTips: Sow carrot seeds directly into loose, well-prepared soil.
Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged for germination.
Thin carrot seedlings to allow room for root development.
